message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it presents a novel approach to encoding prior knowledge about correct behavior in imitation learning. It also uses a Bayesian approach to treat the value of a policy in a modeling MDP as the log prior probability of the policy. Additionally, the paper presents empirical evidence that this prior speeds up learning of the mentor's policy. 

The paper could also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as it deals with learning from demonstrations and modeling the behavior of a mentor. 

The robotics (cs.RO) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper deals with learning how to behave in a stochastic environment, which is relevant to robotics. 

The systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category is another possibility as the paper deals with learning how to behave in a stochastic environment, which is relevant to control systems. 

Finally, the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category is a possibility as the paper deals with learning from demonstrations, which is relevant to computer vision tasks such as object recognition and tracking.
